sentence.text: Whether this boosted his morale or irked him is unclear .
She was the most efficient secretary he had ever had and it irked him that she had made it clear that , if and when he moved , she would wish to stay at Larksoken .
It has irked the Northern selectors that the talent drain has largely led to London , the side that has dominated the Divisional Championship in recent years .
There was something about the wizard that irked Him beyond measure .

However , he maintained an obvious disdain for the customs of the True People which irked Burun .
That kind of thing irked her , as did the difference in pay between women and men for doing practically the same work .
But his insight irked her .
` Ever the gracious hostess , I see , " he said with a cool irony , looking round the neatly furnished and immaculately tidy room with an expression on his face that irked her .
For some reason that irked her .
It was hardly surprising , therefore , that my refusal to accompany him to America so irked him .
Although he was growing fast , Hari was still taller than he was , a matter which quite clearly irked him .
And as before , perversely the thought of parting even for a day irked him .
Of medium height and build , he had an air of self-confidence which irked Paula , although she recognized his first-rate brain .

Older fans have been irked by this change of direction .

What irked her more than anything else was that Spittals was probably right .

In a way , this irked him and always had done .
He believes such an outcome would only irk independent software companies .

Edward felt like a colonial or a schoolboy , and it irked .
